Authors:
Alfredo Vizzini, Enrico Ercole, Claudio Angelini, Matteo
Gelardi, Timothy J. Baroni
Title:
Phylloporus and Phylloboletellus are no longer alone:
Phylloporopsis gen. nov. (Boletaceae), a new smooth-spored lamellate
genus to accommodate the American species Phylloporus boletinoides
Keywords:
Boletales, Bothia, molecular phylogeny, Greater Antilles,
neotropical boletes, new taxa, Phyllobolites, taxonomy
Abstract:
The monotypic genus Phylloporopsis is described as new to
science based on Phylloporus boletinoides reported here for the first
time from a neotropical montane pine woodland in the Dominican Republic
but also known to occur widely in eastern and gulf coastal states of
North and Central America. The confirmation of this monophyletic bolete
line is supported and molecularly confirmed by a multilocus phylogenetic
inference (ITS, nrLSU, tef1 datasets). A detailed morphological
description of the collections of P. boletinoides found in the Dominican
Republic is provided accompanied by color images of fresh basidiomes in
habitat, line drawings of the main anatomical features, transmitted
light microscopic images (LM) of anatomical features and scanning
electron microscope (SEM) images of the basidiospores. The taxonomic
placement, ecological requirements and distribution patterns of P.
boletinoides are investigated/reviewed and its relationship with closely
allied, similar lamellate and boletoid taxa such as Phylloporus,
Phylloboletellus, Phyllobolites and Bothia is discussed.
